intro: Deinandra wrightii, commonly known as Wright's sandmat, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its woolly, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Deinandra wrightii is adapted to drought conditions and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
